author: kameshj
msg: Prior to this fix, if '/tmp' were *not* a working copy and
/tmp/abc existed as a directory, then running
'svn mkdir --parents abc' from within '/tmp' would delete
'/tmp/abc'.  The fix is to delete '/tmp/abc' upon failure only if
this command had created it in the first place.
only if this invocation has created it.

author: kameshj
msg: Extend the testcase for issue #3067 to cover more cases.
Cherry pick 'r2' from ^/A/D/H before cherry harvest.
